SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlphaBeta
Implements Part II of the project: computes White's optimal move using Alpha-Beta pruning.
AlphaBetaAlgorithm
Implements the Alpha-Beta pruning algorithm for optimal move selection in Jumpy3.
BasicEstimator
Basic static estimation function as specified in the Jumpy3 project handout.
Board
Represents a Jumpy3 game board state and provides move generation logic.
ImprovedEstimator
Enhanced static estimation function with multifactor heuristic analysis.
JumpyTestSuite
Comprehensive test suite for Jumpy3 AI implementations.
JumpyTestSuite.ExpectedResult
Container for expected algorithm output values
JumpyTestSuite.TestCase
Represents a test case with input board and expected outputs
MiniMax
This class implements the first part of the project: using the MiniMax algorithm to determine the best move for the White player in the Jumpy3 game.
MiniMaxAlgorithm
Implements the MiniMax algorithm for determining optimal moves in Jumpy3.
MiniMaxBlack
This class implements Part III of the project: computes Black's optimal move using MiniMax algorithm.
MiniMaxImproved
Implements Part IV of the project: MiniMax with an enhanced static estimation function.
Piece
Represents game pieces and empty spaces in Jumpy3 board configurations.
Player
Represents the two players in a Jumpy3 game session.
ProblemType
Represents different algorithm variants supported by the program.
Result
Represents the outcome of a game tree search algorithm (MiniMax/Alpha-Beta).
StaticEstimator
Defines a contract for static estimation functions used to evaluate board positions in Jumpy3.
Utils
Utility class containing common operations like file I/O, argument parsing, and board validation.
